feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Tonight... Northwest winds of 15 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow will continue tonight, then decrease on Saturday. These winds, combined with slightly elevated sea levels, are causing elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Through Monday... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop tonight over the southern Chukchi Sea continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:59PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties through 1045 PM PDT... At 959 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Cottonwood Visitor, or 18 miles northwest of Chiriaco Summit. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 9:38PM PDT until August 12 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SAN BERNARDINO COUNTY... At 938 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated only light rain falling along Highway 62 from near Earp to west of Vidal Junction. However, earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rain along the highway, and flash flooding may still be ongoing.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 8:11PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
